sub_topic: Using the unit circle to find trigonometric values
message_1: What is the value of sin(π/4), cos(π/4), and tan(π/4) when using the unit circle to find trigonometric values?
message_2:
Using the unit circle to find trigonometric values, we can determine the values of sin(π/4), cos(π/4), and tan(π/4) as follows:

sin(π/4) = sin(45°) = √2/2 ≈ 0.7071

cos(π/4) = cos(45°) = √2/2 ≈ 0.7071

tan(π/4) = tan(45°) = sin(π/4) / cos(π/4) = (√2/2) / (√2/2) = 1

So, sin(π/4) ≈ 0.7071, cos(π/4) ≈ 0.7071, and tan(π/4) = 1.
